pairtree

Class PairPath

  • java.lang.Object
    • pairtree.PairPath
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Morty, PairTree, Shorty

    public abstract class PairPath
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a path within a pairtree folder structure. All paths have exactly one equivalent file, which is the deepest directory in the path. Paths can exist with no child paths and no leaf nodes.

    • Method Detail

      • getFile

        public java.io.File getFile()
        Returns the file that this path represents. The file is garuanteed to be a directory.
        Returns:
        the file that this path represents

      • getLeaves

        public abstract java.io.File[] getLeaves()
        Returns an array of all the leaves contained specifically by this PairPath. A file is considered a pairtree leaf if its name is three characters or more.
        Returns:
        the objects contained by this PairPath

      • getChildPaths

        public abstract PairPath[] getChildPaths()
        Returns an array of all the PairPaths that extend through this PairPath.
        Returns:
        the PairPaths that extend through this PairPath

      • getEscapedName

        public abstract java.lang.String getEscapedName()
        Returns the name of the path, as represented by the PairTree format, after cleansing. This method assumes that the PairTree only contains properly escaped names.
        Returns:
        the escaped name of the path

      • getUnescapedName

        public java.lang.String getUnescapedName()
        Returns the name of the path, before it was converted to PairTree format. This method assumes that the PairTree only contains properly escaped names.
        Returns:
        the unescaped name of the path

      • hasLeaves

        public boolean hasLeaves()
        Returns whether the path contains leaves at this level. Does not recurse over child paths.
        Returns:
        true if the path contains leaves

      • hasChildPaths

        public boolean hasChildPaths()
        Returns whether the path ends here or can be followed deeper through child paths.
        Returns:
        true if the path contains child paths

      • fromFile

        public PairPath fromFile(java.io.File file)
        Attempts to create a PairPath from the given file.
        Parameters:
        file - the source of the PairPath
        Returns:
        a new PairPath
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the file is not a directory, or has a name longer than two characters

      • unescape

        public static java.lang.String unescape(java.lang.String name)
        Takes a filesystem friendly string, and maps it to its' original UTF-8 string, based on successive pairs of characters.
        Parameters:
        name - the escaped version of the string
        Returns:
        the original string before it was escaped

      • escape

        public static java.lang.String escape(java.lang.String name)
        Takes an arbitrary UTF-8 string, and maps it into a filesystem friendly string, based on successive pairs of characters.
        Parameters:
        name - the string to be escaped
        Returns:
        the escaped version of the original string
